did.abstract: Soldier from Fruitport, Mich., member of Co. I, 339th U.S. Infantry who served in the Allied intervention in Russia, 1918-1920, the "Polar Bear Expedition." Collection includes a diary, article from The Literary Digest, and newspaper clipping describing his combat experiences in Russia.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Cleo M. Colburn, of Fruitport, Michigan, in 1984 (Donor no.: 7133).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box no., Cleo M. Colburn papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Resident of Fruitport, Mich., served as corporal, Co. I, 339th Infantry.

scopecontent.p: The papers, all photocopies, include a typescript of Colburn's diary, Sept. 1918-April 1919, which contains very brief accounts of his experiences, including fighting on several fronts and the alleged mutiny of Co. I. Also included are a short reminiscence, a newspaper clipping containing a letter from Colburn describing fighting along the railroad in Sept. 1918, and an article from The Literary Digest describing the "mutiny" of Co. I. The originals of the papers are owned by Colburn.
